reviews.review_msg: He is amazing. You probably hear a lot about caring professors but he is #1. Absolutely amazing, organized, caring, sweet, and tells you exactly what you need to know to get an A. Don't need the textbook.

Don't buy a textbook. The textbook is confusing and makes it hard to understand. He posts a-lot lecture of lecture slides and most of them are useless, so it can be hard to navigate what your looking for. He's super approachable and seems very friendly, however his accent made the class a huge struggle for me. I found the lectures to be very boring
Don't bother buying the textbook. Read the lecture slides and you'll be fine!! He's an amazing guy.

Do not buy the textbook! It's so boring and it covers no more material than what is already covered in lectures. His tests are full of short essay questions that you have to memorize but you don't know which ones will be asked, so it can be stressful. However, he is very approachable and understanding and is willing to help with any questions.

Had this prof my first year, he's such a caring guy. However it's really hard to understand him with his accent. His slides are a bit disorganized and hard to cover again. However his class is almost impossible to fail, theres so much participation and other things that will keep your grade up. Put in the work you'll be sure to get an A.

Nice guy, but not a very good professor. Asked me and a few friends to help him hand out exams and proceeded to start the test while we were still handing them out. Class isn't necessarily hard, but Mr. Myint sure does make it stressful and confusing.

I would most definitely recommend him as a prof for any HSCI course at SFU. He is very educated and is very passionate. GPA BOOSTER!! He is EXTREMELY reasonable on the amount of work he assigns. Though, he LOVES group projects so make sure you pick your group wisely. Not much to do but the projects are tedious and worth a lot. but no exams at all!!

Really enjoyed his class, he made the exams similar to the exam prep which was extremely helpful. Put in good work into this class and you will definitely get a good mark! I miss having him as a prof and hope to take a course with him again. Group project heavy for some assignments choose wisely. Take a course with him as your prof.

Easiest course ever and the best prof. His accent makes it difficult to understand, but he is amazing. His exams are straightforward and just put a little bit of work into projects and it's a huge GPA booster. Would take it again with this prof! Very reasonable and fair and wants his students to succeed.
His study guides are very similar to the exams.
Gives you exam questions, just have to memorize them all
Mr. Myint is a great teacher. Very helpful and quick with the e-mail. His lecture are quite straight forward and easy to understand. He is always willing to help. I would definitely took him again.

I loved this class, It was not mandatory to come to lecture or tutorial, the exams were very simple as they were based straight from the notes - nothing tricky. Group projects were a breeze and easy marks. He also gave learning outcomes which helped in studying and he always made sure everyone understood the concepts. Overall, a very caring prof!

Keep asking for practice midterms & finals!!!! His mc on exams is his iclicker so go to class it helps. His written is based off of his study guide but he wants everything in depth. Ask questions. His assignments and projects were quite easy pick a good group

Very caring and knowledgable!! However, he has a very thick accent and it is hard to make out what he is saying. Also, he only reads directly off of the slides.. no additional info in his talks. iClicker questions are the same as the exam Qs & exam prep is what is on the exams. Participate in iClicker and tutorial and brief the practice easy A

Really nice prof. Really wants his students to succeed. His exam questions are straight from lecture slides and clicker questions and he gives study questions before the exam. His lectures are much more straightforward than the textbook so you don't actually need to buy the textbook as long as you read the slides thoroughly.

Honestly such a nice person in general. He genuinely wants his students to pass and makes it easy to do so. Midterms and exams are literally straight from his lecture slides, so if you go through those thoroughly, youll be fine. Tons of group work. Overall, this was a good class

The instructor will focus your attention on the reading textbook. However, midterms and final are based on the lecture-slides, you DO NOT need textbook at all. I would recommend to attend all lectures, listen carefully then you will have B grade, in general.
Easy Course. Do well in your group projects. Midterms and exams are super easy.

Honestly such a sweet prof, he is a bit hard to understand as he does have a thick accent, however he tries really hard to do his best!! Midterms and exam questions are literally given to students ahead of time, all multiple choice are the iclicker questions from class. Overall this class was extremely easy and marking was very fair!!

Amazing professor, very helpful and willing to answer questions after lectures. Midterms are very straight forward as long as you study and work hard for the grades. He provides information that is going to be on the midterms so attend all lectures and listen very carefully! Lecture slides are also posted on canvas before the start of each lecture.

he's very kind and cares about your learning. keeps everyone informed frequently with announcements or emails and provides many resources for your learning. he also holds online office hours which are really helpful. midterms/exam questions were really fair. if you miss anything in lecture his powerpoints have you covered (didn't even use textbook)

gives you all the things to need in order to do well on the midterms (there's 2) and final ex. review packages and hints on things you need to know for the exam. He hosts online discussions a day or two before an exam which is very helpful if you have last minute questions. Content-wise, there's a lot to memorize
His midterms and final is right from his prep questions.
I had a slight problem understanding his accent at the beginning, but he is a nice prof otherwise. He is an easy marker.

He is the best prof for the HSCI130 course even though the course has a lot of materials. His midterm 1 was easy, midterm 2 was average and the final was not as hard as it was cumulative. His MCQ and fill in the blanks were all in his I-clicker questions. Honestly, his lectures were boring even though the materials were interesting.

He is the best prof for all HSCI Courses. His midterm 1 was super easy and midterm 2 was average. The final was cumulative and the prof held 2 online office hours to clear our doubts and also gave us formula sheet in the final for calculations. Not only this he was super nice and caring. I would like to take more courses again with him.

The final is cumulative and there is a ton of info to memorize for it and he doesnt give a very clear exam prep outline. The second midterm was also extremely difficult, it had a lot of calculations on it and the class average was very low. This class is not a GPA booster like many people think.. if you take it you need to definitely focus on it.
Exam all sucks. Soooooooo many homework and spend like ten hours on only one assignment. For the final, 150 points over for 30 credits... So many stuff needs to memorized.

Tun has very high standard with writing assignments. He gives great feedback. I wish I read the grading rubric before I submitted my essay. His passion and knowledge are contagious! His class is discussion heavy for intro but I love it.

Worst prof at sfu. Although he has several degrees and designations, it's not clear when talking to him that he's an expert in his field. He is very difficult to understand, has group projects worth 50% of one's grade, and has an incredibly monotone voice. I will never take another class with him again.
If his midterm wasn't that hard, he'd get a 5 star from me. Other than midterm, he's pretty good and relaxed

He gave us test prepare question and the test is almost the same as those questions. And you can also earn extra credit from fill in feedback. Group work are also easy, the average for group work is around a-. Definitely will take his course again!

HORRIBLE PROFESSOR. This professor is very hard to understand (and I'm normally fine with accents). I had issues with my group, I literally did all the work, I talked to him about the issues several times, and he still wasn't willing to grade me based on the work I did. My worst grade of my degree. He doesn't post slides or explain concepts well.

all the assignments were easy, midterms are all hard af the average for each one was around 60%, everytime the class asks him to explain something he just says exactly what he said the class before, didnt learn anything, tutorials and lectures are boring it's a waste of your 4 hrs every week tbh, lectures are always all over the place

Genuine prof who cares about how well his students do in class. If you go to office hours and ask for help, he's always willing to explain the best he can although he has a heavy accent. There's a lot of readings and lecture slides, but it's expected for a 4 credits course. Overall, I recommend this prof :)

very heavy accent, however, he tries very hard to explain concepts.  very approachable with questions. gives many bonus points and credits for people who misses attendance and exam materials were based on his review questions

Super nice prof. His answers to student's questions are not clear. Grading is fair. The team projects were pretty easy but the instructions were unclear (3 parts, 2 presentations) Practice exam questions were provided so the questions on the midterms (2) and final were no surprise. Final exam consists of 3 parts so you have to study for everything

Very similar to his HSCI481 class. Term group project with 2 parts (2 reports, 2 presentations). Difficulty of this class is not high but there are a lot of different components so it adds up to a fair amount of work. Stay caught up and you'll do well in the course. For the exams (he calls them quizzes), all the questions are provided in advance.
